page.title: 05 History of Barham
page.content: Barham's name is Saxon(ham=homestead bar=bear),and was included in the first Domesday book.Bears are on the arms of Barham and Reginald Fitzurse,a knight who held the manor(now Barham Court)and was involved with the murder of Thomas a Becket( 1170 ).The school was built in 1858.It still has a bell-tower & school-house,but steps on the lawn have gone & the headmaster no longer lives in.Infant mobiles are sited on old school allotments.The store shed was a bomb shelter in the 2nd.World War. St.John the Baptist(Church with copper spire)dates from 12th.century.Blacking Bottle Cottage was a workhouse(vagrants gathered flints to earn their keep).The Old Bakery stables are now a house! Broome Park Estate was sold by the Digges family to the Oxendens,and by them to Lord Kitchener.The Black Mill was destoyed by fire in 1970.
